             I am an enthusiast in sustainability and circular economy especially in the raw material value chain and recycling. I chose the AMIR program because it provides both practical scientific knowledge and entrepreneurship aspects in such a way that each and every student gets an opportunity to excel in the real world.

               <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_1 et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
                <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
                 <h2>
                  Erasmus Mundus AMIR Master Programme: Integrating Chemistry, Material Science, and Sustainability for Circular Economy
                 </h2>
                 <p>
                  <span style="font-weight: 400;">
                   In 2021 the AMIR Master Programme obtained the Erasmus Mundus Joint Master (EMJM) label from the European Commission recognizing the Excellence of the AMIR Master Programme, already successfully implemented as a 2-years course of study since 2017.
                  </span>
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  <span style="font-weight: 400;">
                   The AMIR-EMâs four main disciplines targeted are: chemistry, chemical engineering, material science and engineering. AMIR-EM will enhance their competitiveness by integrating these disciplines with sustainability, recycling and circular economy considerations. Cross-fertilisation will be assured through the joint an interdisciplinary approach, through the invitation of renowned external scholars and through a thorough selection of students.
                  </span>
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  <span style="font-weight: 400;">
                   AMIR-EM will provide higher education on recycling of raw materials, in particular sophisticated advanced materials with currently low recycling rates. These include multiple material types, including metals, minerals, polymers and ceramics. Products consisting of these materials are sold in multiple markets such as telecommunication, mobility, housing and energy supply. Therefore, AMIR-EM addresses important issues of innovative recycling and material chain optimisation for end-of-life products and the design of products and services for the circular economy.
                  </span>
                 </p>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>

                <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
                 <h2>
                  Discover AMIR EM Master Program
                 </h2>
                 <h3>
                  The strengths of the programme
                 </h3>
                 <p>
                  An important strength of the programme is the complementarity of partners in terms of their expertise. This applies to both academic and industry partners, and it is one of the main attractions for prospective students. Multidisciplinarity is thereby built in the consortium and curriculum.
                 </p>
                 <h3>
                  First-year choices: Advanced materials, Clean technology and Polymers
                 </h3>
                 <p>
                  For the first year, students can choose between UBx, UNL and UM. While UBx courses focus on Advanced Materials Sciences and Sustainability, UM focusses on recycling processes in polymers and composites, and UNL teaches courses on Advanced Materials Engineering and Clean Tech. That means students can choose between a more materials and sustainability science orientated studies in Bordeaux, a specialisation on polymers in Miskolc, or a stronger engineering and technology focus in Lisbon. UMâs focus on polymer recycling is unique worldwide and a real asset to AMIR-EMâs comprehensive academic approach.
                 </p>
                 <h3>
                  Third semester options: Metallurgy, Design for recycling, and Circular economy
                 </h3>
                 <p>
                  For the third semester students can choose among UPM, TUDa and ULiÃ¨ge. Courses in LiÃ¨ge will focus on metals recycling, while Darmstadt specialises in the design for recycling of functional materials, and Madrid on minerals and building materials recycling in the context of the circular economy.
                 </p>

                <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
                 <h2>
                  AMIR-EM Master Thesis: Sustainability, Innovation, and Entrepreneurship in Interdisciplinary European Mobility Programs
                 </h2>
                 <p>
                  <b>
                   The Master thesis
                  </b>
                  <span style="font-weight: 400;">
                   in the fourth semester can be done in any of the six AMIR-EM partner universities; however, it will be done under the supervision of the M2 host university and defended there. In all tracks, students will obtain transversal knowledge to achieve overarching learning outcomes (OLO) related to sustainability, innovation and entrepreneurship; these will be partly taught as joint activities. The AMIR-EM tracks have been designed to facilitate and promote not only interdisciplinary knowledge and an entrepreneurial mindset, but also North-South and West-East mobility across Europe.
                  </span>
                 </p>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>

              </div>

             <div class="et_pb_module dsm_breadcrumbs dsm_breadcrumbs_0">

          <div class="et_pb_section et_pb_section_1 et_section_specialty">
           <div class="et_pb_row">
            <div class="et_pb_column et_pb_column_2_3 et_pb_column_1 et_pb_specialty_column et_pb_css_mix_blend_mode_passthrough">
             <div class="et_pb_row_inner et_pb_row_inner_0">
              <div class="et_pb_column et_pb_column_4_4 et_pb_column_inner et_pb_column_inner_0 et-last-child">
               <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_1 et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
                <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
                 <h2>
                  Mobility plan
                 </h2>
                 <h3>
                  Track 1 : Innovative materials and functional materials recycling
                 </h3>
                 <p>
                  <span>
                   In the first track, students study Innovative Materials and Functional Materials Recycling. They spend the first year in Bordeaux and the second year they are enrolled in Darmstadt, where they study the third semester. Track 1 deals with the development of innovative materials and on the recycling of functional materials.
                  </span>
                 </p>
                 <h3>
                  Track 2 : Innovative Materials and Circular Economy
                 </h3>
                 <p>
                  <span>
                   In the second track, students study Innovative Materials and Circular Economy. They spend the first year in Bordeaux and the second year they are in enrolled in Madrid, where they study the third semester. Track 2 also deals with the development of innovative materials, put in the context of the circular economy.
                  </span>
                 </p>
                 <h3>
                  Track 3 : Polymer Recycling and Functional Materials Recycling
                 </h3>
                 <p>
                  <span>
                   In the third track, students study Polymer Recycling and Functional Materials Recycling. They spend the first year in Miskolc and the second year they are enrolled in Darmstadt, where they study the third semester. Track 3 tackles the recycling of two specific types of materials: polymers and functional materials.
                  </span>
                 </p>
                 <h3>
                  Track 4 : Polymer and Metals Engineering and Recycling
                 </h3>
                 <p>
                  <span>
                   In the fourth track, students study Polymer and Metals Engineering and Recycling. They spend the first year in Miskolc and the second year they are enrolled LiÃ¨ge, where they study the third semester. Track 4 addresses the recycling of two types of materials: polymers and metals, with an additional focus on engineering
                  </span>
                 </p>
                 <h3>
                  Track 5 : Materials Engineering and Circular Economy
                 </h3>
                 <p>
                  <span>
                   In the fifth track, students study Materials Engineering and Circular Economy. They spend the first year in Lisbon and the second year they are enrolled in Madrid, where they study the third semester. Track 5 deals with materials engineering broadly speaking, put in the context of the circular economy.
                  </span>
                 </p>
                 <h3>
                  Track 6 : Materials Engineering and Metals Recycling
                 </h3>
                 <p>
                  <span>
                   In the sixth track, students study Materials Engineering and Metals Recycling. They spend the first year in Lisbon and the second year they are enrolled in LiÃ¨ge, where they study the third semester. Track 6 tackles materials engineering broadly speaking and the recycling of metallic materials.
                  </span>
                 </p>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>

                <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
                 <h2>
                  Admission and eligibility criteria
                 </h2>
                 <h3>
                  Application period
                 </h3>
                 <p>
                  <span style="font-weight: 400;">
                   The application period for applications to the AMIR Erasmus Mundus Master Programme (2025-2027) will be open from Wednsday 2nd October, until Friday 24th January 2025 at 11:59 a.m. (Central European Summer Time).
                  </span>
                 </p>
                 <h3>
                  Who can apply ?
                 </h3>
                 <p>
                  The programme is aimed at candidates who have a Bachelorâs degree in Engineering and Environmental Sciences, with advanced knowledge in Chemistry (minimum 3 years of study or 180 ECTS credits), or a Bachelorâs Degree in Chemistry, Physical-Chemistry, Materials (or Matter) Sciences.
                 </p>
                 <h3>
                  Selection criteria
                 </h3>
                 <p>
                  <b>
                   Candidates are assessed and selected on the following qualifying factors:
                  </b>
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  <b>
                  </b>
                 </p>
                 <ul>
                  <li aria-level="1" style="font-weight: 400;">
                   <span style="font-weight: 400;">
                    Academic background
                   </span>
                  </li>
                  <li aria-level="1" style="font-weight: 400;">
                   <span style="font-weight: 400;">
                    Motivation letter
                   </span>
                  </li>
                  <li aria-level="1" style="font-weight: 400;">
                   <span style="font-weight: 400;">
                    Language skills
                   </span>
                  </li>
                  <li aria-level="1" style="font-weight: 400;">
                   <span style="font-weight: 400;">
                    Work experience
                   </span>
                  </li>
                  <li aria-level="1" style="font-weight: 400;">
                   <span style="font-weight: 400;">
                    Entrepreneurial potential
                   </span>
                  </li>
                  <li aria-level="1" style="font-weight: 400;">
                   <span style="font-weight: 400;">
                    Multiple Choice Quiz*
                   </span>
                  </li>
                 </ul>
                 <p>
                  <em style="font-size: 16px;">
                   * This is a multiple choice quiz to test candidatesâ general scientific knowledge to ensure that candidates have the minimum level required to take part in the programme. Be aware that there is a time limit to answer each question.
                  </em>
                 </p>

            <div class="et_pb_column et_pb_column_2_3 et_pb_column_1 et_pb_specialty_column et_pb_css_mix_blend_mode_passthrough">
             <div class="et_pb_row_inner et_pb_row_inner_0">
              <div class="et_pb_column et_pb_column_4_4 et_pb_column_inner et_pb_column_inner_0 et-last-child">
               <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_1 et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
                <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
                 <h2>
                  Guidelines
                 </h2>
                 <h3>
                  How to complete electronic application form
                 </h3>
                 <p>
                  <span style="font-weight: 400;">
                   In order to complete the
                   <a href="https://emundus-amir.u-bordeaux.fr/en/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                    electronic application form
                   </a>
                   , please follow the steps detailed here.
                  </span>
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  <span style="font-weight: 400;">
                   Note that you may save every completed page independently and work on the application form at different times, but you will not be able to change your data after the final submission. All fields with an asterisk (*) must be completed.
                  </span>
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  <span style="font-weight: 400;">
                   The application form must be completed in English. All attachments need to be translated into English and should be in either pdf or jpg formats and should not exceed 5mb in size. Check your spam folder in case you donât immediately receive our automatic emails. Also, please donât wait until the last minute to submit your application form to avoid any potential technical problems.
                  </span>
                 </p>
                 <h3>
                  1/ Create an account
                 </h3>
                 <p>
                  <span style="font-weight: 400;">
                   Create an account on the AMIR online application portal.
                  </span>
                 </p>
                 <h3>
                  2/ Confirm
                 </h3>
                 <p>
                  <span style="font-weight: 400;">
                   Confirm your account from the received email.
                  </span>
                 </p>
                 <h3>
                  3/ Sign in
                 </h3>
                 <p>
                  <span style="font-weight: 400;">
                   Complete all pages of the application form.
                  </span>
                 </p>
                 <h3>
                  4/ Application
                 </h3>
                 <p>
                  <span style="font-weight: 400;">
                   Sign in with your username and password.
                  </span>
                 </p>
                 <h3>
                  5/ Upload documentation
                 </h3>
                 <p>
                  <span style="font-weight: 400;">
                   If you are missing a document then you can upload an explanatory note instead, or send an e-mail to
                   <a href="mailto:amir.master@u-bordeaux.fr">
                    amir.master@u-bordeaux.fr
                   </a>
                   .
                  </span>
                 </p>
                 <h3>
                  6/ Submit application
                 </h3>
                 <p>
                  <span style="font-weight: 400;">
                   Submit your completed application form by clicking on the âsubmitâ button that will appear once 100% of the application form is completed. Make sure that you have received an email confirming that your application has been saved.
                  </span>
                 </p>

       <div class="entry-content">
        <div class="et-l et-l--post">
         <div class="et_builder_inner_content et_pb_gutters3">
          <div class="et_pb_section et_pb_section_0 et_pb_with_background et_section_regular">

              <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
               <h1>

               </h1>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="et_pb_module dsm_breadcrumbs dsm_breadcrumbs_0">
              <div class="et_pb_module_inner">

          <div class="et_pb_section et_pb_section_1 et_section_specialty">
           <div class="et_pb_row">
            <div class="et_pb_column et_pb_column_2_3 et_pb_column_1 et_pb_specialty_column et_pb_css_mix_blend_mode_passthrough">
             <div class="et_pb_row_inner et_pb_row_inner_0">
              <div class="et_pb_column et_pb_column_4_4 et_pb_column_inner et_pb_column_inner_0 et-last-child">
               <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_1 et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
                <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
                 The AMIR Programme welcomes students from across the world. AMIR is a world leading programme in the field of materials recycling, but we believe that education should be as accessible to all and we take pride in graduating the raw materials innovators of the future.
                 <h2>
                  Annual fees for the AMIR Erasmus Mundus Programme :
                 </h2>
                 <p>
                  EMJM students do NOT pay these fees, as our goal is to give everyone access to education.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  4500â¬/year for European students*
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  9000â¬/year for students from the rest of the world**
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  *Denotes students from EU member states and countries defined by the European Commission as âthird countries associated to the programmeâ.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  ** Denotes students from countries defined by the European Commission as âthird countries not associated to the programmeâ.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  See :
                  <a href="https://erasmus-plus.ec.europa.eu/programme-guide/part-a/eligible-countries" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                   https://erasmus-plus.ec.europa.eu/programme-guide/part-a/eligible-countries
                  </a>
                 </p>
                 <h2>
                  Erasmus Mundus Joint Master (EMJM) scholarships
                 </h2>
                 <p>
                  The AMIR Master obtained the EMJM label and funding at the end of 2021, meaning we offer scholarships for 4 intakes of students, beginning with the 2022-2024 intake. These scholarships are offered to a limited number of candidates with the highest scores following the written and oral evaluation in the selection process. They can be considered as full scholarships, with the amount being 1400â¬ per month for the 2 year duration of the programme. This amount is intended to cover all costs incurred by studentsâ participation in the Master programme (accommodation, travel costs, subsistence costs, materials etc). In addition to this, EMJM scholarship holders do not pay the AMIR fees (detailed above), and are provided with comprehensive insurance for the 2 year duration of the programme.
                 </p>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>

              <div class="et_pb_column et_pb_column_4_4 et_pb_column_inner et_pb_column_inner_0 et-last-child">
               <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_1 et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
                <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
                 <h2>
                  Boosting Careers in Materials Recycling & Innovation through Networking
                 </h2>
                 <p>
                  The AMIR-EM summer schools aim at facilitating the insertion and career progression of AMIR-EM students and young professionals into the market of materials recycling and innovation as well as related ecosystems through a list of complementary tools such as alumni interaction and speed-dating with companies provided by the summer schools. These events will allow for intensive networking among industry, start-ups, incubators, young professionals having obtained the AMIR-EM master diploma and AMIR-EM students.
                 </p>
                 <h2>
                  Expanding Knowledge and Opportunities : Summer Schoolsâ Contribution to Raw Materials Innovation & Alumni Networking
                 </h2>
                 <p>
                  The summer schools will widen the domain of knowledge and skills by offering additional pedagogical contents on industrial and economic intelligence and providing other complementary tools for better insertion in the market of raw materials innovation. Gathering cohorts at different stages of their training and professional experience will foster the confrontation of ideas as function of needs and experiences. In addition, the summer schools content includes a graduation ceremony and a matchmaking meeting with industrial partners, start-ups, incubators. All is done to open a window of opportunities for the students as well as to potential recruiters. This will be accompanied by the creation and consolidation of an international AMIR-EM alumni network to make a student association become alive.
                 </p>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>

                <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
                 <h2>
                  <strong>
                   Required documents
                  </strong>
                 </h2>
                 <p>
                  Photocopies (or e-mailed pdf files) are sufficient for applications. However, you may be asked to provide original documents before the admission process is completed. Moreover, âoriginalâ certified copies must be presented always for the final registration (at the Induction weeks). Translation into English is needed now but sworn translation into Spanish or French might be required for the final registration
                 </p>
                 <h2>
                  <strong>
                   Data protection
                  </strong>
                 </h2>
                 <p>
                  Information collected from applicants will be used only for the purposes for which it was collected and to support the Universityâs central activities (mainly teaching and research). It also supports procedures which underpin activities such as admission, enrolment, accommodation, examinations, alumni activities and helps us to compile records and statistics.
                 </p>
                 <h2>
                  <strong>
                   Information relating to individuals (personal data)
                  </strong>
                 </h2>
                 <p>
                  Personal data is collected and used by Neurasmus in accordance with the Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) OJ L 119/1, 4.5.2016.
                 </p>
                 <h2>
                  <strong>
                   EACEAÂ´s Privacy Statement
                  </strong>
                 </h2>
                 <p>
                  The Education, Audiovisual and Culture Executive Agency (âEACEAâ) is dedicated to respecting the privacy of natural persons participating in grant award procedures. As the evaluation and follow-up of the applications will require the recording and further processing of personal data by the EACEA, all personal data are dealt with in accordance with Regulation (EU) No 2018/1725 on the protection of personal data by the Union institutions, bodies, offices and agencies1 (âthe data protection regulationâ): Regulation (EU) 2018/1725 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 23 October 2018 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data by the Union institutions, bodies, offices and agencies and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Regulation (EC) No 45/2001 and Decision No 1247/2002/EC Text with EEA relevance, OJ L 295, 21.11.2018, p. 39. Ref. Ares(2019)5175167 â 09/08/2019
                  <br/>
                  .
                 </p>

            <div class="et_pb_column et_pb_column_1_3 et_pb_column_2 et_pb_css_mix_blend_mode_passthrough">
             <div class="et_pb_with_border et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_2 et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
              <div class="et_pb_text_inner">

               </h3>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_3 et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
              <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
               <p>
                For any request :

                 <h2>
                  DISCLAIMER
                 </h2>
                 <p>
                  All reasonable steps are taken to ensure that the content of this website is accurate and updated, namely regarding applications, scholarships and activities. We will do our best to correct as soon as possible any errors brought to our attention (to amir.master@u-bordeaux.fr). Neurasmus does not accept any responsibility or liability whatsoever for any mistake or omission in reliance on this website (including but not limited to any direct or consequential loss or damage that might occur to you and/or any other third party) arising out of / or in connection with the information on this website, including those regarding the documents it publishes.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  In case of disagreement related to legal information published in this website, the most recent legal or official text will always prevail.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  Neurasmus will do its best to minimize disruption caused by technical errors. However, we cannot guarantee that our service will not be interrupted or otherwise affected by such problems. Neurasmus accepts no responsibility whatsoever with regard to such problems incurred as a result of using this website.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  The content of this website may only be used for non-commercial and/or private purposes. Neurasmus does not give any license or right to use any logo displayed on this site without written permission from us.
                 </p>
                 <h2>
                  PERSONAL DATA PROTECTION
                 </h2>
                 <p>
                  Personal data is collected and used in accordance with the Regulation (EC) NÂ° 45/2001 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 18.12.2000 on the protection of individuals with regard to the processing of personal data by the Community institutions and bodies and on the free movement of such data (OJ L8 of 12.1.2001, P.1).
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  Neurasmus is committed to user privacy. Neurasmus collects personal information exclusively to the extent necessary to select the candidates. Neurasmus will use your personal details to record your application and to contact you if necessary. We will only use your details within Neurasmus for administrative purposes of the project. We will by no means communicate your details to non-involved third parties, nor will we use these details or allow them to be used for commercial purposes.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  The information will not be re-used for an incompatible purpose neither divulged for direct marketing purposes.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  Candidatesâ personal data will be sent to the Education, Audiovisual and Culture Executive Agency (EACEA) and may be used by other bodies involved in the management of Erasmus Mundus for facilitating the student candidateâs access to the joint programme. UE-EACEA privacy statement.

          <h1 class="entry-title main_title">
           Cookies policy (UE)
          </h1>
          <div class="entry-content">
           <div class="cmplz-document cookie-statement cmplz-document-eu" id="cmplz-document">
            <p>
             <i>
              This Cookie Policy was last updated on September 25, 2023 and applies to citizens and legal permanent residents of the European Economic Area and Switzerland.
             </i>
             <br/>
            </p>
            <h2>
             1. Introduction
            </h2>
            <p>
             Our website,
             <a href="https://www.amir-em-master.com">
              https://www.amir-em-master.com
             </a>
             (hereinafter: âthe websiteâ) uses cookies and other related technologies (for convenience all technologies are referred to as âcookiesâ). Cookies are also placed by third parties we have engaged. In the document below we inform you about the use of cookies on our website.
            </p>
            <h2>
             2. What are cookies?
            </h2>
            <p>
             A cookie is a small simple file that is sent along with pages of this website and stored by your browser on the hard drive of your computer or another device. The information stored therein may be returned to our servers or to the servers of the relevant third parties during a subsequent visit.
            </p>
            <h2>
             3. What are scripts?
            </h2>
            <p>
             A script is a piece of program code that is used to make our website function properly and interactively. This code is executed on our server or on your device.
            </p>
            <h2>
             4. What is a web beacon?
            </h2>
            <p>
             A web beacon (or a pixel tag) is a small, invisible piece of text or image on a website that is used to monitor traffic on a website. In order to do this, various data about you is stored using web beacons.
            </p>
            <h2>
             5. Cookies
            </h2>
            <p class="cmplz-subtitle">
             5.1 Technical or functional cookies
            </p>
            <p>
             Some cookies ensure that certain parts of the website work properly and that your user preferences remain known. By placing functional cookies, we make it easier for you to visit our website. This way, you do not need to repeatedly enter the same information when visiting our website and, for example, the items remain in your shopping cart until you have paid. We may place these cookies without your consent.
            </p>
            <p class="cmplz-subtitle">
             5.2 Marketing/Tracking cookies
            </p>
            <p>
             Marketing/Tracking cookies are cookies or any other form of local storage, used to create user profiles to display advertising or to track the user on this website or across several websites for similar marketing purposes.
            </p>
            <h2>
             6. Placed cookies
            </h2>

            <h2>
             7. Consent
            </h2>
            <p>
             When you visit our website for the first time, we will show you a pop-up with an explanation about cookies. As soon as you click on âSave preferencesâ, you consent to us using the categories of cookies and plug-ins you selected in the pop-up, as described in this Cookie Policy. You can disable the use of cookies via your browser, but please note that our website may no longer work properly.
            </p>
            <p class="cmplz-subtitle">
             7.1 Manage your consent settings
            </p>
            <div id="cmplz-manage-consent-container-nojavascript">
             You have loaded the Cookie Policy without javascript support.Â On AMP, you can use the manage consent button on the bottom of the page.
            </div>
            <div class="cmplz-manage-consent-container" id="cmplz-manage-consent-container" name="cmplz-manage-consent-container">
            </div>
            <h2>
             8. Enabling/disabling and deleting cookies
            </h2>
            <p>
             You can use your internet browser to automatically or manually delete cookies. You can also specify that certain cookies may not be placed. Another option is to change the settings of your internet browser so that you receive a message each time a cookie is placed. For more information about these options, please refer to the instructions in the Help section of your browser.
            </p>
            <p>
             Please note that our website may not work properly if all cookies are disabled. If you do delete the cookies in your browser, they will be placed again after your consent when you visit our website again.
            </p>
            <h2>
             9. Your rights with respect to personal data
            </h2>
            <p>
             You have the following rights with respect to your personal data:
            </p>
            <ul>
             <li>
              You have the right to know why your personal data is needed, what will happen to it, and how long it will be retained for.
             </li>
             <li>
              Right of access: You have the right to access your personal data that is known to us.
             </li>
             <li>
              Right to rectification: you have the right to supplement, correct, have deleted or blocked your personal data whenever you wish.
             </li>
             <li>
              If you give us your consent to process your data, you have the right to revoke that consent and to have your personal data deleted.
             </li>
             <li>
              Right to transfer your data: you have the right to request all your personal data from the controller and transfer it in its entirety to another controller.
             </li>
             <li>
              Right to object: you may object to the processing of your data. We comply with this, unless there are justified grounds for processing.
             </li>
            </ul>
            <p>
             To exercise these rights, please contact us. Please refer to the contact details at the bottom of this Cookie Policy. If you have a complaint about how we handle your data, we would like to hear from you, but you also have the right to submit a complaint to the supervisory authority (the Data Protection Authority).
